MARCH 16th - 20th

Sturgis Williams Middle School and Stagebarn Middle School were awarded the South Dakota State Library Award for excellence in Program, Place and Profession. Based on a rigorous assessment and submitted evidence, both middle schools were awarded exemplary status (the highest award) and Sturgis Brown High School was awarded Enhanced Status, missing exemplary by just one point.



This award can be applied for every three years, in 2016, Sturgis Williams Middle School and Sturgis Brown High School both received enhanced status. SWMS and Stagebarn Middle School are two of only eight South Dakota school libraries to receive this award this year. Sturgis Brown High School is one of five in its category.



Congratulations to Scottie Bruch, along with paraprofessionals, Amy Beckwith (Stagebarn MS), Cathy Johnson (SBHS), and Cami Goebel (SWMS).

MITCHELL, SD - With 17 schools represented, members from across South Dakota exhibited 125 projects at the 2019 South Dakota FFA State Agriscience Fair. Held at Mitchell Technical Institute, members addressed topics within six categories: Animal Systems, Food Products and Processing Systems, Power, Structural and Technology Systems, Social Science, Environmental Service/Natural Resource Systems, and Plant Systems. A wide variety of ages participated, as there are six divisions in each of the six categories for students to take part in as an individual or team in grades 7th – 12th.

The area of Social Science sponsored as a special project of the South Dakota FFA Foundation, by Bayer and the South Dakota Biotech Association. Two Sturgis Brown High School students placed first in their divisions: Division 3, Matea Gordon (9) and Division 5, Danika Gordon (11).

Four eighth graders from Sturgis Williams Middle School recently participated in an Engineering Competition in Brookings called TEAMS. This national competition gives students an opportunity to discover engineering and how knowledge in engineering can help make a difference in the world. The team members work collaboratively to solve real-world engineering challenges, applying their math and science knowledge in practical and creative ways. The competition involved three parts: design/build, multiple choice and essay.
The SWMS team was ranked nationally against 50+ teams, and they tied for 4th overall!! For the essay portion of the competition, they tied for 1st!! This was for an essay they wrote about artificially intelligent medical nanobots. Congratulations to Owen Cass, Carson Oedekoven, Cale Jolley and Beck Bruch and coach, Scottie Bruch.

Student Council creates Thanksgiving Baskets for families who wouldn’t get a traditional thanksgiving meal.

Student Council had a goal in mind of 25 baskets. This year the students at Sturgis Williams/Intermediate School exceeded that goal and created 59 baskets! YES! 59 baskets- this equaled around 3,500 pounds of food. Students from the Intermediate building as well as SWMS collect food as a competition. It turned into an outstanding event that benefits multiple people in our community. Kristi Cammack and Katy Jutting are the Student Council advisors, they couldn’t be prouder of the students. They feel that it is really important to show the students how to help others and be good role models in the community. Their hope is that the students will continue with these efforts in the future. This is a school wide event: Teachers, advisors, & students collect and promote, while the families are called and pickup is arranged by our counselors. Thank you, students and staff, for being so wonderful!
